raw.Author: Jimmie Coleman
raw.Message:
feat: Complete CI/CD pipeline with RAG improvements and UI updates

Major Updates:
- GitHub Actions: Full CI/CD with 7-tool security scanning
  - detect-secrets, Semgrep, Trivy, Bandit, Safety, npm audit, Conftest/OPA
  - Matrix builds for API and UI images
  - GHCR image publishing with proper tags
  - Method 2 (Terraform + LocalStack) deployment instructions

RAG Pipeline Refactor:
- Split into 2-step process: prepare_data.py → ingest_data.py
- Fixed ChromaDB timeout issues (increased to 120s)
- Fixed embedding dimension mismatch (768-dim nomic-embed-text)
- Added ingest_k8s.sh for production ChromaDB sync
- 2,656+ embeddings now working in production

UI Improvements:
- Added "Key Responsibilities Demonstrated" section to Landing page
- Added "Repository Overview" tree structure
- Improved box contrast (bg-snow/10)
- ChatBoxFixed timeout increased to 60s

API Fixes:
- CHROMA_URL environment variable support
- Increased chat timeout to 60s
- Better error handling for RAG queries

Production: https://linksmlm.com (verified working)

raw.Author: Jimmie Coleman
raw.Message:
feat: Complete Method 1 deployment with OPA Gatekeeper enforcement

Successfully deployed Portfolio application using simple kubectl manifests with
comprehensive security policies enforced by OPA Gatekeeper v3.20.1.

Deployment Changes:
- Fixed OPA Gatekeeper v3.20.1 compatibility (openAPIV3Schema, v1beta1 APIs)
- Added security contexts and seccompProfile to all deployments
- Created ChromaDB console-only logging via ConfigMap
- Simplified secrets to only require CLAUDE_API_KEY
- Added Python prerequisite scripts for Gatekeeper and policy deployment
- Fixed PV/PVC binding with empty storageClassName

Security Improvements:
- All pods running as non-root (UID 1000 or 10001)
- seccompProfile: RuntimeDefault on all pods
- Capability drop ALL on all containers
- Read-only root filesystem (except ChromaDB)
- OPA Gatekeeper runtime policy enforcement active

Reorganization:
- Moved Gatekeeper policies to GP-copilot/gatekeeper-temps/
- Moved security reports to GP-copilot/reports/
- Removed unused infrastructure/addons and method2 files
- Added comprehensive troubleshooting documentation

Current Status:
✅ 3/3 Pods Running (ChromaDB, API, UI)

feat: implement GitHub Actions CI/CD for linksmlm.com

🚀 Complete CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions:
- Secure GHCR image building and pushing
- Automated security scanning with Trivy
- Local KinD deployment via registry pull
- Integration with existing Cloudflare tunnel

✨ Key Features:
- No secrets required (uses GITHUB_TOKEN)
- Builds API and UI containers from Dockerfiles
- Deploys to portfolio namespace (matches tunnel config)
- Local deployment scripts with webhook listener
- Complete documentation and setup guides

🔧 Architecture:
GitHub Actions → GHCR → Local KinD → Cloudflare Tunnel → linksmlm.com

🎯 Ready for: Make change → Push → Auto-build → Deploy → Live site

  -l, --log-level string                                                                                 log level (trace, debug, info, warn, error, fatal) (default "info")
      --log-opts string                                                                                  git log options
      --max-target-megabytes int                                                                         files larger than this will be skipped
      --no-banner                                                                                        suppress banner
      --no-color                                                                                         turn off color for verbose output
      --redact uint[=100]                                                                                redact secrets from logs and stdout. To redact only parts of the secret just apply a percent value from 0..100. For example --redact=20 (default 100%)
  -f, --report-format string                                                                             output format (json, csv, junit, sarif) (default "json")
  -r, --report-path string                                                                               report file
  -s, --source string                                                                                    path to source (default ".")
  -v, --verbose                                                                                          show verbose output from scan

Use "gitleaks [command] --help" for more information about a command.
